subtitle: with diuers fourmes of entreis playntes processis presentmentes and other matters determinable there.
title: The maner of kepynge a courte Baron and a Lete
publishers: In vico qui vocatur Fletstret, per me Robertum Redman

notes.value:
In English, Law French and Latin.

Title within architectural border; royal arms on verso of t.p. within ornamental border; initials.

This edition is essentially an enlarged version of the 1533 edition by Redman with more in English and including the Novae additiones. The first edition was printed in 1510 by Wynkyn de Worde with title: Modus tenendi curiam baronis. Cf. STC.

Irregularities in foliation.

Signatures: A-D⁸ E⁶.

LC copy has bookplate of Harvard Law Library.

LC copy bound by Hayday in tooled morocco.

STC (2nd ed) 7714

Beale, J.H.  Engl. law, T190

ESTC S105511
